data.name: Common_Key_Help
data.value: The key is used to identify this item in scripts and must be unique with respect to it's parent. One a key has been assigned, it can not be changed.

data.name: Common_Key_Validation
data.value: The key must use only letters and numbers, and must be lowercase and must be between 3 and 20 characters.

data.name: Deployment_Listeners_Help
data.value: A deployment contains listeners. A listener monitors a service, port or protocol for incoming messages. A deployment can contain main listeners.

data.name: Deployment_Planner_Help
data.value: Your deployment needs a planner. The Planner is used to map a device and message to a route that will be executed to process the message.

data.name: DeviceConfiguration_Description
data.value: A Device Configuration is the specification for how messages should be processed by NuvIoT, this is where you create routes that contain pipeline modules that act on the data from the messages.

data.name: DeviceConfiguration_Help
data.value: A Device Configuration is the specification for how messages should be processed by NuvIoT, this is where you create routes that contain pipeline modules that act on the data from the messages.

data.name: Errs_AlreadyDeployed
data.value: Your instance has already been deployed. You can not re-deploy it.

data.name: Errs_InstanceBusy
data.value: Your instance is busy, please try again later.

data.name: Errs_MustBeStoppedBeforeRemoving
data.value: Your instance must be completely stopped or have a fatal error prior to removing it.

data.name: Errs_NotDeployed
data.value: Your instance has not been successfully deployed. Please deploy it prior to start, pausing and stopping your instance.

data.name: Err_InstanceNotRunning
data.value: Your instance is not running, please start your instance or try again later.

data.name: Host_AdminAPIUri_Help
data.value: The Admin API URI is the location of the API that supports starting, stopping and checking the status of the deployments

data.name: Host_AdminEndpoint_Help
data.value: The full uri including the port that will be used to communicate with run time.

data.name: Host_Description
data.value: The Deployment Host is information about the compute resource that is hosting the run time, this could be for any of the deployment options. This is primarily used by a System Admin, but can be provisioned as a dedicated resource by a user

data.name: Host_Help
data.value: The Deployment Host is information about the compute resource that is hosting the run time, this could be for any of the deployment options. This is primarily used by a System Admin, but can be provisioned as a dedicated resource by a user

data.name: Host_ComputeResourceId_Help
data.value: The Compute Resource ID is the ID of the compute resource in the environment that is hosting the machine. This is usually the ID of the machine with the hosting/cloud provider.

data.name: Host_ComputeResource_Uri_Help
data.value: The Instance URI is the base location for the compute resource

data.name: Instance_Description
data.value: This is an Instance of a Solution that will be used to process messages from your devices. It consists components you have created and configured such as the Listener, Planner, Device Configurations and Workflow.

data.name: Instance_Help
data.value: This is an Instance of a Solution that will be used to process messages from your devices. It consists components you have created and configured such as the Listener, Planner, Device Configurations and Workflow.

data.name: Instance_Host_Help
data.value: The Compute Resource that will be Hosting Your Instance.

data.name: Instance_IsDeployed_Help
data.value: Will be true if this instance has been deployed to a Host, this doesn't necessarily mean it is running.

data.name: Route_Description
data.value: A Route is a set of Pipeline modules that will be used to interpret and process data sent by messages from your devices.

data.name: Route_Help
data.value: A Route is a set of Pipeline modules that will be used to interpret and process data sent by messages from your devices.

data.name: Route_IsDefault_Help
data.value: For each device configuration you can optionally configure one route as default. If the planner can not find a route by message id, if a default route is specified that default route will be executed.

data.name: Route_Messages_Help
data.value: You can map or create a message with a message id that is associated with this route. If the incoming messages, message id matches one that is associated with a route, that route is executed.

data.name: Solution_Description
data.value: A Solution is where you assemble all the components that will be used as an application to listen to and process data sent by messages from your devices. Solutions are reusable components that can be published by dedicated instances.

data.name: Solution_DeviceConfigurations_Help
data.value: Add the Device Configurations that Make up your Deployment.

data.name: Solution_Help
data.value: A Solution is where you assemble all the components that will be used as an application to listen to and process data sent by messages from your devices. Solutions are reusable components that can be published by dedicated instances.

data.name: Err_ErrorCommunicatingWithHost
data.value: There was an error communicating with the Host Server, please try again later.

data.name: Err_InstanceAlreadyRunning
data.value: Your instance is already running, please try again later.

data.name: Err_InstanceWithoutHost
data.value: You must specify a Host prior to deploying your instance.

data.name: Err_InstanceWithoutSolution
data.value: You must associate a solution prior to deploying your instance.

data.name: Err_CouldNotLoadDeviceConfiguration
data.value: System Error: Could Not Load Device Configuration

data.name: Err_CouldNotLoadListener
data.value: System Error: Could Not Load Listener

data.name: Err_CouldNotLoadPlanner
data.value: System Error: Could Not Load Planner

data.name: Err_CouldNotLoadSolution
data.value: System Error: Could Not Load Solution

data.name: Err_NoPlannerHasBeenSpecified
data.value: Your solution does not appear to have a Planner configured. Please add one.

data.name: Err_CouldNotLoadInstance
data.value: System Error: Could not load Instance.

data.name: Telemetry_ErrorQueryServer
data.value: Could not query Telemetry Server, please try again later.

data.name: Err_MCPServerExists
data.value: MCP Server Already Exists, only one MCP Server is allowed per system.

data.name: Err_MultipleMCPServersFound
data.value: Multiple MCP Servers Were Found, Please contact System Administrator

data.name: Err_MultipleNotificationServersFound
data.value: Multiple Notification Servers Were Found, Please contact System Administrator

data.name: Err_NoMCPServerExists
data.value: No MCP Server Exists for this System, Please Add One.

data.name: Err_NoNotificationsServerExists
data.value: No Notifications Server Exists for this System, Please Add One.

data.name: Err_NotificationServerExists
data.value: Notifications Server Already Exists, only one Notifications Server is allowed per system.

data.name: Instance_DeviceRepo_Help
data.value: Your instance needs a dedicated device repository where you can add and access devices that are part of this instance. Please select or create a Device Repository that will be used by this Instance.

data.name: ContainerRepository_Description
data.value: A Container Repository is a Location where containers can be downloaded and insatlled on Remote Compute Instances

data.name: ContainerRepository_Help
data.value: A Container Repository is a Location where containers can be downloaded and insatlled on Remote Compute Instances

data.name: ContainerRepository_Namespace_Help
data.value: The namespace of the repository as configured on the Registry

data.name: ContainerRepository_Password_Help
data.value: NOTE: This is only tempoary until we implement OAuth, the password will be used to login to repo on the remote instance to allow downloading the image and is stored in secure storage on the server.

data.name: ContainerRepository_Registry_Help
data.value: Currently only Docker Hub is Enabled

data.name: ContainerRepository_RepositoryName_Help
data.value: The name of the repository as configured on the Registry

data.name: ContainerRepository_UserName_Help
data.value: NOTE: This is only tempoary until we implement OAuth, the username will be used to login to repo on the remote instance to allow downloading the image and is stored in secure storage on the server.

data.name: TaggedContainer_Description
data.value: A Tagged Container is an Instance of a Container that can be Installed on a Remote Compute Instance

data.name: TaggedContainer_Help
data.value: A Tagged Container is an Instance of a Container that can be Installed on a Remote Compute Instance

data.name: Host_CloudProvider_Help
data.value: Currently we only support Digital Ocean, Azure and AWS coming Second Half of 2017

data.name: ContainerRepository_Preferred_Help
data.value: If you are creating a new host, you should select this tag unless you have a good reason not to.

data.name: Err_CouldntStart_NotOffline
data.value: You can not issue a start command for this host as it is not currently offline.

data.name: Err_CouldntStop_NotRunning
data.value: You can not issue a stop command for this host as it is currently not running.

data.name: Err_CantPublishNotRunning
data.value: Sorry, your host does not appear to be running, you can't deploy a container to a non-running host.

data.name: DeviceConfiguration_Properties_Help
data.value: Properties are fields that will always be assocaiated with the devices of this device configuration. They are used to generate a user interface that will be used to configure the device.

data.name: Err_EmptyRoute
data.value: Route requires at least one pipeline module

data.name: Err_RouteModule_ModuleIsRequired
data.value: Route Module requires a Pipeline Module to be assigned

data.name: Host_ShowSiteDetails_Help
data.value: If this option is selected you will be able to get the details from your site by going to the url http://[HostServerName]/solutions

data.name: Warning_NoDeviceConfigs
data.value: There are no Device Configurations on your solution, you probably need at least one.

data.name: Warning_NoListeners
data.value: There are no Listeners on your solution, you probably need at least one.

data.name: Err_CouldNotFindDestinationModule
data.value: Could not find destination pipeline module on route

data.name: Instance_InputCommandPort_Help
data.value: Specify the port that the listener should listen on for the Input Command web server, this is normally port 80 for non SSL listeners and 443 for SSL listeners.

data.name: Instance_InputCommandSSL_Help
data.value: Specify if your input commands should only listen on an SSL port. You may want to disable this if your clients do not support SSL.

data.name: Host_DebugMode_Help
data.value: With debug mode enabled, the host will log and display considerably more telemetry as well spend less time batching that telemetry to be sent to the server. This may provide a performance penatly on a high capacity system.

data.name: Instance_DebugMode_Help
data.value: With debug mode enabled, the host will log and display considerably more telemetry as well spend less time batching that telemetry to be sent to the server. This may provide a performance penatly on a high capacity system.

data.name: Solution_Settings_Help
data.value: Solution Settings are values that can be used or changed globally that can be access by any logic used within that solution

data.name: DeviceConfiguration_CustomStatusType_Help
data.value: You can select a state set that will be used define a custom set of state that represent the current status of the device.

data.name: RemoteDeployment_Description
data.value: A Remote Deployment is an On-Premisis version of the run time where all the intances have local storage

data.name: RemoteDeployment_Help
data.value: A Remote Deployment is an On-Premisis version of the run time where all the intances have local storage

data.name: ClientApp_Description
data.value: A client app is a thick/mobile/external application that will authenticate and access NuvIoT via REST

data.name: ClientApp_Help
data.value: A client app is a thick/mobile/external application that will authenticate and access NuvIoT via REST

data.name: DeviceConfiguration_DeviceIdLabel_Help
data.value: You can add a label that will be used in the user interface when devices with this device configuration edit/display the Device Id

data.name: DeviceConfiguration_DeviceLabel_Help
data.value: By default things created in our system are called Devices, you can override that by changing the name.

data.name: DeviceConfiguration_DeviceNameLabel_Help
data.value: By default the field used to describe the device name is Device Name, you can override that.

data.name: DeviceConfiguratoin_DeviceTypeLabel_Help
data.value: A device configuration can have many device types, those device types can have a customized label.

data.name: DeviceConfiguration_DeviceTypeLabel_Help
data.value: You can define what you call device types on this device configuration

data.name: DeploymentQueueType_QueueTechnology_Help
data.value: Select the type of technology that will be used to queue PEMS (pipeline execution messages) as they are processed by Pipeline Modules

data.name: DeploymentInstance_SharedAccessKey_Help
data.value: Your access key will only be visible when you create your instance or when you regenerate it. The access key will be need to be added to your instance if you deploy it on premise.

data.name: DeploymentInstance_Version_Help
data.value: You can optionally select a version to deploy. If you leave this blank it will deploy the most recent version.

data.name: Deployment_Logging_Help
data.value: Cloud will publish your usage statistics and diagnostics logs in the cloud. Local will store them in local storage on your on premise installation.

data.name: Integration_Description
data.value: Provides a container to capture information about integration into other products

data.name: Integration_Help
data.value: Provides a container to capture information about integration into other products

data.name: DeviceConfiguration_WatchDogEnabled_Default_Help
data.value: If you enable the watchdog, a timer will ensure that your devices communicates within the watchdog interval. If it does not you will receive a notification.

data.name: DeviceConfiguration_WatchDogTimeout_Help
data.value: Number of seconds before the watch dog will timeout and send a notification.

data.name: WorkingStorage_Help
data.value: Specify where data collected and generated by NuvIoT will be stored

data.name: DeploymentInstance_HealthCheckEnabled_Help
data.value: By defaulf if your instance is in a running state, a service will ensure that it is online. if it is not every hour the primary contact for the instance will receive a text message and an email. With health check enabled not set, you will only receive an email or text message when it is determined that the instance is online.

data.name: Common_IsPublic_Help
data.value: If you create this object as a public object it will be available to other users to use and clone within their application. You will be the only person allowed to edit it.

data.name: DeviceErrorCode_Description
data.value: A device error code is a string that can be invoked to generate an error or exception from a device.

data.name: DeviceErrorCode_Help
data.value: A device error code is a string that can be invoked to generate an error or exception from a device.

data.name: DeviceErrorCode_TicketTemplate_Help
data.value: This is the service ticket that will be generated when this error condition is detected.

data.name: DeviceErrorCode_TriggerOnEachOccurrence
data.value: Generate service ticket on each occurence

data.name: DeviceErrorCode_TriggerOnEachOccurrence_Help
data.value: You can specify if you want to generate a service ticket on each occurence of this error code, or only generate a service ticket when there is not currently a on open ticket.

data.name: DeviceErrorCode_AutoExpiresTimespan_Help
data.value: If this amount of time goes by and this error code is no longer generated, this error code will be cleared.

data.name: DeviceErrorCode_DistributionList_Help
data.value: Specify the distribution list you wish to notifiy when this error code is generated.

data.name: DeviceErrorCode_EmailSubject_Help
data.value: Provide a subject to be sent along with your email notification, to include the device id use [DEVICEID] and to use the device name, use [DEVICENAME].

data.name: DeviceErrorCode_NotificationInterval_Help
data.value: You can specify how often you will receive notifications via SMS and Email

data.name: MessageWatchDog_Description
data.value: A message watch dog will allow you to configure checks on messages sent from your devices, if a message is not received within configured watch dog periods, an error will be thrown.

data.name: MessageWatchDog_ErrorCode_Help
data.value: Error that will be generated when the watch dog expires

data.name: MessageWatchDog_Exclusion_Description
data.value: Exclusion is a period of time when the watch dog should not be checked.

data.name: MessageWatchDog_Exclusion_End_Help
data.value: End time for the exclusion period, must be number representing the time such as 1030 for 10:30 AM and 1415 for 2:15 PM

data.name: MessageWatchDog_Exclusion_Help
data.value: Exclusion is a period of time when the watch dog should not be checked.

data.name: MessageWatchDog_Exclusion_Start_Help
data.value: Start time for the exclusion period, must be number representing the time such as 1030 for 10:30 AM and 1415 for 2:15 PM

data.name: MessageWatchDog_Help
data.value: A message watch dog will allow you to configure checks on messages sent from your devices, if a message is not received within configured watch dog periods, an error will be thrown.

data.name: MessageWatchDog_Message_Help
data.value: Message to be expected from the device to clear the watchdog

data.name: MessageWatchdog_Timeout_Help
data.value: Enter the timeout as a number, defined by the timeout interval that should be used to watch messages.

data.name: DeploymentInstance_TimeZone_RegEx
data.value: Time Zone must be between 3 and 5 upper case characters and be a valid time zone.

data.name: MessageWatchDog_StartupBuffer_Help
data.value: Enter the amount of time in minutes that should be used as a startup buffer after an exclusion period. That is to say the number of minutes after the device is expected to start receiving messages to allow for a message to come in. Without this buffer as soon as the exclusion period ends, it will immediately expect a message or will consider the message overdue.

data.name: Solution_DefaultListener_Help
data.value: You can select a default listener for this solution, if you do the settings for that listener can automatically be available for any devices that are added to this solution.

data.name: WiFiConnectionProfile_Description
data.value: Contains SSID and Password of connection profiles that can be used to provisoin a device.

data.name: WiFiConnectionProfile_Help
data.value: Contains SSID and Password of connection profiles that can be used to provisoin a device.

data.name: DeploymentInstanceCredentials_Description
data.value: Deployment instance credentials are used to authenticate services, devices, communications channels and users with a deployment instance.

data.name: DeploymentInstanceCredentials_Help
data.value: Deployment instance credentials are used to authenticate services, devices, communications channels and users with a deployment instance.

data.name: DeploymentInstanceCredentials__Expires_Help
data.value: Date when credentials should no longer be valid

data.name: Instance_InputCommandBasicAuthUserName
data.value: Input Command Basic Auth User Name

data.name: ContainerRepository_IsDefautForRuntime_Help
data.value: Should be selected for the default runtime to be used for most deployments.

data.name: RouteModuleConfig_Help
data.value: A Route Module is a module configuration that is part of the processing route for a message.

data.name: Instance_Credentials_Help
data.value: Credentials can be used at the instance level to authorize access to instnace data by services.

data.name: Instance_Solution_Help
data.value: The solution is the definition of how the messages sent from your devices should be procseed. Please select a solution, if none are available, you will need to create one. A solution can be used by multiple instances.

data.name: Instance_Subscription_Help
data.value: You must associate this instance with a subscription that will be used for billing of the resources used to host the instance.

data.name: Instance_InputCommandAnonymous_Help
data.value: Input Commands are REST end points that are defined as part of your Work Flow, setting Anonymous to true will not require any authentication for these end points to be called. This is not recommended.S

data.name: WatchdogConnectedDevice_Help
data.value: Devices as being monitored by the run time.

data.name: WatchdogMessage_Help
data.value: Messages as being tracked by the runtime engine

data.name: WatchdogExclusion_AllDay_Help
data.value: The watch dog should not be checking for messages on this day.

data.name: Telemetry_Help
data.value: Records generated by run time engine

data.name: DeploymentActivities_Help
data.value: Activities in the publishing or updating of an IoT application

data.name: DeviceNotifications_Description
data.value: Definition of notifications that can be sent out to devices

data.name: DeviceNotification_TagHelp
data.value: The following tags will be replaced in the generated content [DeviceName] [DeviceId] [DeviceLocation] [DeviceSummary] [NotificationTimeStamp]
